channel.title: Indiana on Jack's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Indiana on Jack's Blog

item.title: DT::datatable seasoned with javascript
item.description: Indiana Coronavirus Case Model I’ve been working on a statistical model for predicting daily COVID-19 case counts in Indiana. I gathered data from 7 places: https://github.com/RamiKrispin/coronavirus https://www.coronavirus.in.gov/2393.htm https://trends.google.com/trends/?geo=US https://evictionlab.org/ https://www.gstatic.com/covid19/mobility/Global_Mobility_Report.csv https://www.wfyi.org/ https://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products/rural-urban-commuting-area-codes/ I also manually included the “phases” for Holcomb’s Back on Track plan. Results My model is still in development, but I’ve made some progress. Set aside the last 28 days as testing data and trained my model on the remaining data.
